intro: Cheirinia aspera, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single, flat head and bloom in late summer. Cheirinia aspera is often found in meadows and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
